content: I think on the last one… out of the 1700ish people that identified themselves as having a disability (out of the 50k or so that took the entire survey)… 1% of those people were blind and half a percent were deaf… so 17 people and about 9 people out of the 51,000 or so identified themselves as either deaf or blind. That makes more sense to me than 3 out of every 200. Am I reading that right?
